s1.sentence: Science 148 The following are the laws of refraction of light .

s2.sentence: ( i ) The incident ray , the refracted ray and the normal to the interface of two transparent media at the point of incidence , all lie in the same plane .

s3.sentence: ( ii ) The ratio of sine of angle of incidence to the sine of angle of refraction is a constant , for the light of a given colour and for the given pair of media .

s4.sentence: This law is also known as Snell ’s law of refraction .

s5.sentence: ( This is true for angle 0 < i < 90o )

s6.sentence: If i is the angle of incidence and r is the angle of refraction , then , sin sin i r = constant ( 9.4 )

s7.sentence: This constant value is called the refractive index of the second medium with respect to the first .

s8.sentence: Let us study about refractive index in some detail .

s10.sentence: The Refractive Index You have already studied that a ray of light that travels obliquely from one transparent medium into another will change its direction in the second medium .

s11.sentence: The extent of the change in direction that takes place in a given pair of media may be expressed in terms of the refractive index , the “ constant ” appearing on the right hand side of Eq. ( 9.4 ) .

s12.sentence: The refractive index can be linked to an important physical quantity , the relative speed of propagation of light in different media .

s13.sentence: It turns out that light propagates with different speeds in different media .

s14.sentence: Light travels fastest in vacuum with speed of 3×108 m s–1 .

s15.sentence: In air , the speed of light is only marginally less , compared to that in vacuum .

s16.sentence: This is why the ray emerges parallel to the incident ray .

s17.sentence: However , the light ray is shifted sideward slightly .

s18.sentence: What happens when a light ray is incident normally to the interface of two media ?

s20.sentence: Now you are familiar with the refraction of light .

s21.sentence: Refraction is due to change in the speed of light as it enters from one transparent medium to another .

s22.sentence: Experiments show that refraction of light occurs according to certain laws .

s23.sentence: Activity 9.10 Activity 9.10 Activity 9.10 Activity 9.10 Activity 9.10 n Fix a sheet of white paper on a drawing board using drawing pins . n Place a rectangular glass slab over the sheet in the middle . n Draw the outline of the slab with a pencil .

s24.sentence: Let us name the outline as ABCD .

s26.sentence: n Fix two pins , say E and F , vertically such that the line joining the pins is inclined to the edge AB .

s27.sentence: n Look for the images of the pins E and F through the opposite edge .

s28.sentence: Fix two other pins , say G and H , such that these pins and the images of E and F lie on a straight line .

s29.sentence: n Remove the pins and the slab .

s30.sentence: n Join the positions of tip of the pins E and F and produce the line up to AB .

s31.sentence: Let EF meet AB at O .

s32.sentence: Similarly , join the positions of tip of the pins G and H and produce it up to the edge CD .

s33.sentence: Let HG meet CD at O ′ . n Join O and O ′ .

s34.sentence: Also produce EF up to P , as shown by a dotted line in Fig .

s36.sentence: Science 134 Light – Reflection and Refraction 9 CHAPTER W e see a variety of objects in the world around us .

s37.sentence: However , we are unable to see anything in a dark room .

s38.sentence: On lighting up the room , things become visible .

s40.sentence: During the day , the sunlight helps us to see objects .

s41.sentence: An object reflects light that falls on it .

s42.sentence: This reflected light , when received by our eyes , enables us to see things .

s43.sentence: We are able to see through a transparent medium as light is transmitted through it .

s44.sentence: There are a number of common wonderful phenomena associated with light such as image formation by mirrors , the twinkling of stars , the beautiful colours of a rainbow , bending of light by a medium and so on .

s45.sentence: A study of the properties of light helps us to explore them .

s46.sentence: By observing the common optical phenomena around us , we may conclude that light seems to travel in straight lines .

s47.sentence: The fact that a small source of light casts a sharp shadow of an opaque object points to this straight line path of light , usually indicated as a ray of light .

s49.sentence: If an opaque object on the path of light becomes very small , light has a tendency to bend around it and not walk in a straight line – an effect known as the diffraction of light .

s50.sentence: Then the straight line treatment of optics using rays fails .

s51.sentence: To explain phenomena such as diffraction , light is thought of as a wave , the details of which you will study in higher classes .
